title: Commercial Aircraft and Jet Engines
description: An investigation initiated under Section 232 of the Trade Expansion Act of 1962 to determine if imports of commercial aircraft and jet engines threaten to impair U.S. national security.
source: U.S. Department of Commerce (Bureau of Industry and Security)

title: Copper and Derivative Products
description: A Section 232 investigation initiated on March 10, 2025, concerning the effects of imports of copper and derivative products on U.S. national security.
source: U.S. Department of Commerce (Bureau of Industry and Security), JDSupra, White & Case LLP, Pillsbury Winthrop Shaw Pittman LLP

title: Lumber and Timber and Derivative Products
description: A Section 232 investigation initiated on March 10, 2025, examining the impact of imports of lumber, timber, and derivative products on U.S. national security.
source: U.S. Department of Commerce (Bureau of Industry and Security), JDSupra, White & Case LLP, Pillsbury Winthrop Shaw Pittman LLP

title: Pharmaceuticals and Pharmaceutical Ingredients
description: A Section 232 investigation initiated on April 1, 2025, to assess whether imports of pharmaceuticals and pharmaceutical ingredients, including finished drug products and critical inputs, threaten to impair U.S. national security.
source: U.S. Department of Commerce (Bureau of Industry and Security), White & Case LLP, Pillsbury Winthrop Shaw Pittman LLP

title: Processed Critical Minerals and Derivative Products
description: A Section 232 investigation initiated on April 22, 2025, focusing on the effects of imports of processed critical minerals and their derivative products on U.S. national security.
source: U.S. Department of Commerce (Bureau of Industry and Security), Pillsbury Winthrop Shaw Pittman LLP

title: Semiconductors and Semiconductor Manufacturing Equipment (SME)
description: A Section 232 investigation initiated on April 1, 2025, to determine if imports of semiconductors, SME, and derivative products impair U.S. national security, addressing concerns over strategic dependencies and supply chain vulnerabilities.
source: U.S. Department of Commerce (Bureau of Industry and Security), White & Case LLP, Pillsbury Winthrop Shaw Pittman LLP

title: Trucks (Medium and Heavy-Duty) and Parts
description: A Section 232 investigation initiated on April 22, 2025, examining the national security impact of imports of medium-duty trucks, heavy-duty trucks, and their parts.
source: U.S. Department of Commerce (Bureau of Industry and Security), Pillsbury Winthrop Shaw Pittman LLP

title: China's Maritime, Logistics, and Shipbuilding Sectors
description: A Section 301 investigation initiated by the USTR on China's practices in these sectors, focusing on dominance and unfair practices. The USTR is currently seeking public comments on proposed modifications to actions taken in this investigation, including fees on certain maritime carriers.
source: U.S. Trade Representative (USTR), Holland & Knight, Federal Register

title: Brazil's Digital Trade Practices
description: A Section 301 investigation initiated on July 9, 2025, by the USTR regarding Brazil's digital trade policies and other unfair trading practices that allegedly restrict U.S. digital exports and burden U.S. commerce.
source: U.S. Trade Representative (USTR), Supply Chain Dive, CCIA

title: China's Technology Transfer Policies and Practices
description: A long-standing Section 301 investigation concerning China's forced technology transfer policies, which led to the imposition of tariffs on Chinese goods.
source: Great Lakes Customs Law, USTR

title: China's Targeting of the Semiconductor Industry for Dominance
description: A Section 301 investigation initiated in December 2024 by the USTR on China's efforts to dominate the semiconductor industry.
source: USTR, Congress.gov

title: Nicaragua Labor Rights, Human Rights, and Rule of Law
description: A Section 301 investigation initiated in December 2024 by the USTR concerning Nicaragua's practices related to labor rights, human rights, and the rule of law, to determine if they are unreasonable or restrict U.S. commerce.
source: USTR, Congress.gov

title: Active Anode Material from China (AD/CVD)
description: An antidumping and countervailing duty investigation initiated in January 2025, targeting imports of active anode material used in lithium-ion batteries.
source: U.S. Department of Commerce (International Trade Administration), U.S. International Trade Commission (USITC), Global Trade Alert, Expeditors

title: Thermoformed Molded Fiber Products from China and Vietnam (AD)
description: An antidumping investigation where the DOC published preliminary determinations in May 2025.
source: U.S. Department of Commerce (International Trade Administration), Expeditors

title: Float Glass Products from China and Malaysia (CVD)
description: A countervailing duty investigation with preliminary determinations published in May 2025.
source: U.S. Department of Commerce (International Trade Administration), Expeditors

title: Steel Concrete Reinforcing Bar from Algeria, Bulgaria, Egypt, and Vietnam (AD/CVD)
description: Antidumping and countervailing duty investigations initiated in early July 2025, targeting imports of steel rebar.
source: U.S. Department of Commerce (International Trade Administration), International Trade Today

title: Lattice Boom Crawler Cranes from Japan (AD)
description: An antidumping investigation initiated in May 2025.
source: U.S. Department of Commerce (International Trade Administration), Expeditors

title: Silicon Metal from Angola, Australia, the Lao People's Democratic Republic, Norway, and Thailand (AD/CVD)
description: Antidumping and countervailing duty investigations initiated in May 2025.
source: U.S. Department of Commerce (International Trade Administration), Expeditors

title: Paper File Folders from Cambodia and Sri Lanka (AD)
description: An antidumping investigation initiated in May 2025.
source: U.S. Department of Commerce (International Trade Administration), Expeditors

title: Hard Empty Capsules from Brazil, China, India, and Vietnam (AD)
description: An antidumping investigation initiated in May 2025.
source: U.S. Department of Commerce (International Trade Administration), Expeditors

title: Overhead Door Counterbalance Torsion Springs from China and India (AD)
description: An antidumping investigation initiated in May 2025.
source: U.S. Department of Commerce (International Trade Administration), Expeditors
